PROJECT STATEMENT
The project proposes to activate the reserve supply of college graduates
through an accelerated teacher education program involving instruction by
television,.
The first year consists of 26 telecasts. These telecasts are designed to
orient both the pre-service and the in-service participants to the program
of professional education. Successful completion of the series will make
the participant eligible for an individualized program in teacher education
In-service participants who have taught two years and completed the resi¬
dence program may establish eligibility for permanent certification.
When the in-service teacher registers in a cooperating college for these
26 programs, the employing school system will be issued a one-year teach¬
ing permit for this teacher. After satisfactory completion of the first and
second series, both in-service and pre-service participants will be entitled
to teach for or within three years from completion date.
The experiment is designed to recruit a new group of participants each year
for a three-year period in order to provide sufficient time in resolving such
questions as the effectiveness of television as a medium of instruction and
the identification, by accompanying research, of the basic elements of a
teacher education program.
PROJECT OPERATION
Development and operation of the project is assigned to the Assistant Com¬
missioner for Instruction. The project staff has set up machinery for re¬
cruitment, instruction and research. Coordinating committees, organized
in fourteen television areas, will implement the program in the local area,
and advise the project staff and the Commissioner.
